Side Effects: When a function changes the value of a variable outside of its scope
Referential transparency: Two of the same methods with the same parameter can be interchanged anywhere in the program, without affecting the program
Short circuit evaluation: Only calculates the parts of an expression which are needed to determine the result
Narrowing conversion: Converts a value to a type that does not have all values of the original type (i.e. float to int)
Widening conversion: Converts a value to a type that has at least all the values of the original type (i.e. int to float)
